alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Newton; Orange (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 24 at 7:11AM CST until January 24 at 9:15AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CST THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHWESTERN BEAUREGARD AND WEST CENTRAL CALCASIEU PARISHES AND SOUTHEASTERN JASPER, SOUTHWESTERN NEWTON AND NORTHWESTERN ORANGE COUNTIES... At 711 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Orange, Vidor, Kirbyville, Buna, Deweyville, Call, Mauriceville, Pine Forest, Wrights Settlement, Devils Pocket, Old Salem, Gist, Hartburg, Trout Creek, Bancroft and Bleakwood. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
